Comments_List: This class helped develop my aural, singing, and keyboard skills.
Ear Training including identification of chords, intervals, etc., harmonic dictation, solfege, major and minor scales

This course is more work than many full credit courses. If it really is not involved enough to justify being a full credit course at this point it should be developed to deserve a full credit since it would take less work to get it there than to get it down to truly being a half credit course. Though cutting keyboard lab (the third meeting a week!!) would be a good start to making it a half credit course.

I think the small size of the section really helped with the course overall. I felt like I had plenty of practice with everything before I was tested on it. The atmosphere of the smaller section was also more inviting and less stressful than it otherwise could have been.
The class is a nice introductory course to aural skills. It is a great class especially if you want to take lessons.

A good course to take if you're a musician. I'm not a music major but the really basic skills taught in this class have gone a long way for me in some of my other music activities. Pretty low workload and Brian did a good job communicating his expectations and providing practice for everyone in a low-stress way.
YES! Best class to take if you need a music class for lessons.
